Description: Thin penannular gold ear-ring, with a foliate lace-like decoration in the lower part, consisting of a series of six filiform "pelta" type loops, with ends curling inward, welded side by side on the outer contour of the ring and flanked on each side by an S-shaped loop.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "earrings (figs. 2 to 7), of which about forty were found (including fragments) by the Bedawin who hunt the neighbourhood" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "gold earring, solid", ibid., p. 110, pl. xli, 5.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 5)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.82, p.186, pl.28)
